history.content:
Seems like Professor Wagner (the chair) has responded at @16779:

Once you are accepted into the L&S CS major, you will be able to sign up for CS 61C and CS upper-division courses.  We have provided enough capacity in our courses that we anticipate you should have a number of options for CS upper-division courses at that time.

I've just finished meeting with one of the advisors for the CS department regarding enrollment for the fall 2022 semester and I'm worried about my situation and transfer students in general. I'm going to be taking cs70 this summer and hopefully declaring cs by the end of it but at the moment I'm unable to enroll in my desired classes (despite having such an early-enrollment time) because of the recent changes in the cs department and it worries me as to what my class options are for the fall semester. Next semester I will be a senior and although I plan to take an extra semester, my time here at Berkeley is limited. Ideally, I would like to have taken cs61c, cs170, and another tech elective next fall semester but apart from not being allowed to enroll, at this point I'm not even allowed to be waitlisted. Even after talking to an advisor (who also believes the situation to be unfair to transfer students), finding classes that I'm able to enroll in was difficult, especially considering that even if I do declare, the likelihood of the classes being open is slim. What are my options for the fall semester? I understand that the CS department is under a lot of pressure but for students like me what can we do? Any advice would be appreciated. Thank you.
history.subject: transfers and enrollment
